intro: Acmella radicans var. debilis, commonly known as the slender triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that resemble triggers, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb that produces a compact, low-growing rosette of fleshy, succulent leaves. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
